James W. Singleton to Abraham Lincoln, 20 January 18491 Having learned from our mutual friend MrBenj Bond– that he was desirous of the appointment– of Marshall of thisstate. I take great pleasure, in saying– that I. know of no one upon whom the appoint Couldcouldthat would give more general satisfaction among yourwhigfriends– than upon MrBond So far as I am informed and believe– he has the entire approval of our friends for

that office– and for his success permit me to solicit your aid2
